summary: An issue was discovered in Redis 7.2.2. A crafted valkey-cli command with a large number of arguments may cause a client buffer to be trimmed, leading to a client disconnection. The server remains available.
details: An issue was discovered in Redis 7.2.2. A crafted valkey-cli command with a large number of arguments may cause a client buffer to be trimmed, leading to a client disconnection. The server remains available.

summary: A vulnerability in the Redis Lua script execution engine allows an attacker to trigger a heap overflow by sending a specially crafted script. This can lead to a denial of service or potentially remote code execution. This vulnerability is present in Redis versions 7.0.0 to 7.0.10.
details: A vulnerability in the Redis Lua script execution engine allows an attacker to trigger a heap overflow by sending a specially crafted script. This can lead to a denial of service or potentially remote code execution. This vulnerability is present in Redis versions 7.0.0 to 7.0.10.

summary: An integer overflow vulnerability in Redis, in the `str_to_longlong` function, can be triggered by a specially crafted `XAUTOCLAIM` command. This can lead to a heap overflow and potentially remote code execution. This vulnerability is present in Redis versions 7.0.0 to 7.0.3.
details: An integer overflow vulnerability in Redis, in the `str_to_longlong` function, can be triggered by a specially crafted `XAUTOCLAIM` command. This can lead to a heap overflow and potentially remote code execution. This vulnerability is present in Redis versions 7.0.0 to 7.0.3.

summary: A vulnerability in the Redis Lua script execution engine allows an attacker to trigger a heap overflow by sending a specially crafted script. This can lead to a denial of service or potentially remote code execution. This vulnerability is present in Redis versions 2.6 to 7.0.0.
details: A vulnerability in the Redis Lua script execution engine allows an attacker to trigger a heap overflow by sending a specially crafted script. This can lead to a denial of service or potentially remote code execution. This vulnerability is present in Redis versions 2.6 to 7.0.0.

summary: A vulnerability in the Redis Lua script debugger allows an attacker to execute arbitrary Lua code, which can be used to execute arbitrary commands on the server. This can be triggered by sending a specially crafted script to the debugger. This vulnerability is present in Redis versions 2.6 to 7.0.0.
details: A vulnerability in the Redis Lua script debugger allows an attacker to execute arbitrary Lua code, which can be used to execute arbitrary commands on the server. This can be triggered by sending a specially crafted script to the debugger. This vulnerability is present in Redis versions 2.6 to 7.0.0.
